blog.name: dailyvillanelle
blog.title: don’t be pathetic.
blog.description: Welcome to dailyvillanelle! Your #1 source for all things Oksana Astankova (Villanelle) from the BBC America series Killing Eve and the actress who plays her, Jodie Comer. Tracked tags: #dailyvillanelle & #villanelleedit.

blog.name: take-me-to-the-hole
blog.title: ~ Villianeve Trash ~
blog.description: Your typical Killing Eve side blog. Spoilers are NOT tagged because I’m big dumb and can barely keep up with tags as is, so usually every Monday after each episode, I start reblogging episode spoilers!

tags: guess i would tag that to see if any other fans would be interested in giving a follow!!
body:
First Post!!!

Thought I’d say something instead of just suddenly starting to reblog Killing Eve stuff and the like.

So!

Welcome to this blog! It’ll be a Killing Eve only blog that’ll reblog just about anything dealing with Killing Eve! It was also reblog some Villianeve content as well! I may post some of my own fanfiction here and there as well. I’ll keep inbox open too?

Furthermore, if you want me to reblog any Killing Eve artwork or fan works of your own, just tag me in them and I shall do it!

I will use hashtags as well and try to remember to use them. I’m not the best at this, but I want to make this an easy to navigate blog!

Just trying to keep the Killing Eve hype going till 2nd season!


Anyway, thanks y’all! I hope you enjoy!

blog.name: bygone-age
blog.title: House of the Confused & Curious
blog.description:
Tell me a story.

Current fandoms are Dr Who, The Newsroom, Atlantis, The Hour, The Crimson Field (I will NEVER give up hope on either of these) and other assorted bits, bobs and treasures.

Probably too many OTP's but I like a happy ending!

tags: villanelles idea of love is amazing
summary: Do you think Villanelle would have killed Anna if Anna didn't shoot herself?
question: Do you think Villanelle would have killed Anna if Anna didn't shoot herself?
answer:
Okay its really late so I know my answer will be super wishy washy and this is a very difficult question because even the show denies us an answer buuuut:

In one way its so easy to believe because we see Villanelle kill people left and right, getting a kick out of the murders since her emotional structure is *wired* to receive pleasure from watching people die [Like obviously there is a strong pattern because Villanelle pulls out a gun and says “The thing is I can kill you” which is what we usually get with her; some organized weapon and then a kill].

On the other hand though… it seems completely plausible that Villanelle wouldn’t do it. For one because Anna’s suicide definitely takes her by surprise. If Villanelle really would have expected to kill/watch Anna die in that situation I think the show - visually speaking - would have emphazised on it, but it doesn’t.

Instead, her reaction feels reflective of what we have learned about these two which is that they were deeply involved with one another. There is an eerie feeling that makes everything collectively tense, confusing and quite shocking even to her. Compare this to Villanelle’s other kills and you’ll see the change.

So It’s not just the suicide? I think this actually shows that nothing is off limits with Villanelle. Even when it’s her feelings that are most important to her, she has emotions so Anna’s death doesn’t give her pleasure but something entirely different which she cannot decipher either because “We deserve a big lunch” doesn’t actually feel like a reward. For example, the next Villanelle/Irina scene is when Irina tells Villanelle she has decided that Villanelle is a good person because she is sad and “sad people are usually good people because they feel things more”. That’s such an incredible line for multiple reasons. Firstly, it’s coming from a child and children are usually straightforward about how they see/feel about the world around them. Secondly, Irina makes her choice after Anna’s death, which just adds to the, perhaps, sadness that Villanelle goes through. Thirdly, Villanelle’s independence, her freedom, that narcissism (especially that goddamn narcissism) are harshly challenged. She is experiencing a sort of surrender if you’d ask me, leaving her to an open uninflected view of a real world where Anna lives in her own time and rhythm because control actually fails and Anna decides to shoot herself instead.

Which, last but not least, there is also Villanelle’s denial:

We know what Villanelle’s happy face looks like (that truthful satisfaction after a kill), but it is very hard for her to understand herself here. What is it about saying it’s your happy face when you aren’t even smiling? Feeling loss when you’re superior? Elevating your own importance to the point that you think you know how to control a person to get what you want from them? But failing to do so because they choose something else, themselves? Would you kill that person? Or try to change them until they fit into the picture you’ve created for yourself?

Much to think about!

Another thing is that I believe Anna’s death works as a sort of punishment for Villanelle. Or a way to crack into her (Anna being tied up with Villanelle’s past and all) because Anna is kind of a nightmarish image of Villanelle herself and that vulnerability seeps out in the end - which we experience together with Eve. Everything Villanelle goes through and loses comes down in that last scene and when Eve asks Villanelle if she is gonna kill Eve Villanelle shakes her head “no”. So part of the beauty is that Villanelle can even deceive herself. Does she believe she can kill Anna? Did Anna believe it, ever? There’s much complexity when it comes to her history and the people she genuinely obsesses over.

So I don’t know. It’s really hard to read through Villanelle’s impulses because we know the way she sustains her own freedom but what happens when she is confronted with something out of her own space? Like… This is precisely why season two excites me so much already because there is so much to see still.

body: that scene where frank is begging for his life like “please, i have money! i have children!” and villanelle is like “ugh, i don’t want your children” is the best thing to ever be caught on film, the industry can pack it up, they’ve peaked

title: Quick poll
excerpt: PLEASE GO VOTE FOR WHAT SHOW YOU WANT ME TO REVIEW
description:
Hi! I’m starting a new youtube channel for TV reviews.

I have a few shows listed here that I would really be interested in watching/reviewing. I’m going to mention a few things down below but PLEASE GO VOTE for what you want to see on my channel.

Sense8: I’ve never watched Sense8. Never seen an episode or really know what its about other than that they share lives sort-of. I’ve been meaning to watch it but haven’t.

Orphan Black: NEVER WATCHED IT! I know I’m awful :( But I do actually find it interesting - I just haven’t watched it.

The Bold Type S1 REWATCH: This would be a rewatch of season 1. It would help me get into touch with the characters once more and I can talk about different characters, what I like, and compare it to s2.

Killing Eve REWATCH: I’ve seen s1 and LOVED IT. I haven’t seen it since it aired but I’ve been meaning to rewatch it.

Buffy the Vampire Slayer: UGH! My favorite show ever! I love BTVS but haven’t watched it in YEARS! I wanna start with the first season and work upwards maybe?

The L Word: Never seen it. Began s1 but never completely watched it.

American Horror Story Coven + Apocalypse: I really wanna watch this. Especially now that Apocalypse is coming out on tv. I’ve only ever seen Murder House (S1) but I really liked that one.

Wynnona Earp: Haven’t watched it. I’ve been keeping myself up to date with reviews and what’s on my dash but I’ve never actually watched the series before. It does interest me and reminds me of BTVS.

The Handmaids Tale: I began this and got to like… 10 episodes into the first season but that was last year and I don’t really remember it? I do remember that it was a good show.

Harlots: I NEED TO WATCH THIS!

11.22.63: I’m a huge fan of history and I always thought this would be interesting to watch.

Las Estrellas: I’ve watched Flozmin but it was awhile back. I want to see if I can find the actual series so that I can watch it because there was a lot of characters that I really liked and couldn’t view with only the flozmin scenes.

The L Word: Never seen it. Began s1 but never completely watched it.

American Horror Story Coven + Apocalypse: I really wanna watch this. Especially now that Apocalypse is coming out on tv. I’ve only ever seen Murder House (S1) but I really liked that one.

Wynnona Earp: Haven’t watched it. I’ve been keeping myself up to date with reviews and what’s on my dash but I’ve never actually watched the series before. It does interest me and reminds me of BTVS.

The Handmaids Tale: I began this and got to like… 10 episodes into the first season but that was last year and I don’t really remember it? I do remember that it was a good show.

Harlots: I NEED TO WATCH THIS!

11.22.63: I’m a huge fan of history and I always thought this would be interesting to watch.

Las Estrellas: I’ve watched Flozmin but it was awhile back. I want to see if I can find the actual series so that I can watch it because there was a lot of characters that I really liked and couldn’t view with only the flozmin scenes.

trail.content_raw:
Hi! I’m starting a new youtube channel for TV reviews.

I have a few shows listed here that I would really be interested in watching/reviewing. I’m going to mention a few things down below but PLEASE GO VOTE for what you want to see on my channel.

Sense8: I’ve never watched Sense8. Never seen an episode or really know what its about other than that they share lives sort-of. I’ve been meaning to watch it but haven’t.

Orphan Black: NEVER WATCHED IT! I know I’m awful :( But I do actually find it interesting - I just haven’t watched it.

The Bold Type S1 REWATCH: This would be a rewatch of season 1. It would help me get into touch with the characters once more and I can talk about different characters, what I like, and compare it to s2.

Killing Eve REWATCH: I’ve seen s1 and LOVED IT. I haven’t seen it since it aired but I’ve been meaning to rewatch it.

Buffy the Vampire Slayer: UGH! My favorite show ever! I love BTVS but haven’t watched it in YEARS! I wanna start with the first season and work upwards maybe?

The L Word: Never seen it. Began s1 but never completely watched it.

American Horror Story Coven + Apocalypse: I really wanna watch this. Especially now that Apocalypse is coming out on tv. I’ve only ever seen Murder House (S1) but I really liked that one.

Wynnona Earp: Haven’t watched it. I’ve been keeping myself up to date with reviews and what’s on my dash but I’ve never actually watched the series before. It does interest me and reminds me of BTVS.

The Handmaids Tale: I began this and got to like… 10 episodes into the first season but that was last year and I don’t really remember it? I do remember that it was a good show.

Harlots: I NEED TO WATCH THIS!

11.22.63: I’m a huge fan of history and I always thought this would be interesting to watch.

Las Estrellas: I’ve watched Flozmin but it was awhile back. I want to see if I can find the actual series so that I can watch it because there was a lot of characters that I really liked and couldn’t view with only the flozmin scenes.
